Objet: Lettre d'introduction pour Mr. Charles S. Hurlburt, chef de l'Africa Inland Mission
Minutée par: Shhurtz
Bruxelles, le 19 février 1909
Mr. le Gr. Gl.

J'ai l'honneur de vous remettre vous ce pli; un traduction, une lettre adressée par Mr. Charles S. Hurlburt, chef de l'"Africa Inland Mission" á Mr. le Président des Etats Unis d'Amérique. Cette requête a fait l'objet d'une démande de la Légation des Etats Unis de Mr. le Ministre des Affaires Etrangére qui m'en a saisi.

Il a été répondre a M. Davignon qu'il est très difficile de toure á une requête aussi vague et que ça ne posséde aucune indication sur la mission dont il s'agit, les établissement qu'elle possède dejá m' le pays où elle voudrait fonder une station.
Je me suis borné si délivrer pour les intéressés une lettre d'introduction personnelle dont je vous pris de donner exprion ci-joint
Le Ministre des Colonies
Copy of a Letter to the President.

Office of the Secretary of the Home Council of the Africa Inland Mission,
1701 North Fifty-fifth Street.
Philadelphia, Pa. October 22, 1908.
Dear Mr. President:-

Our Mission, which now numbers sixty workers, at twelve different stations, plans to project a line still further to the north-west, toward Lake Tchad. We greatly desire to open a station early in 1909, somewhere along the hills of the boundary between Belgian and British or French territory.

I write in view of your kind offer of yesterday to take the matter up through the State Department, and secure for me such passports or papers as may be helpful to us in our journey along the borders of the Belgian and French Congo. As I am not familiar with their laws, I do not know how just what may be needful, but will be glad of any documents that will be of help as I may touch the frontier forts during the proposed trip of exploration, to locate the station.

Thanking you for your kind offer of help, as well as for your commendation of our industrial plans, I am
Very respectfully yours,
(signad) Charles Hurlburt.
President.

Minister of Colonies

Object: Letter of introduction for Mr. Charles S. Hurlburt, chief of Africa Inland Mission
Timed by: Shhurtz
Brussels, February 19, 1909
Mr. Gr. Gl.

I have the honor to communicate herewith; a translation, of a letter addressed by Mr. Charles S. Hurlburt, chief of "Africa Inland Mission" to Mr. President of the United States of America. This request was the subject of a request of the Legation of the United States of Mr. Minister of Foreign Affaires that seized me.

He had answered Mr. Davignon that he was very difficult to turret to another vague request and that doesn't possess any indication about the mission of which it is about, the establishment that she posside already me the country where she wanted to found un a station.
I limited myself to deliver for those interested in a letter of personal introduction in I expect you to give exprion enclosed
The Minister of Colonies
